20101224212718.000|20101224212720.000|TR0|For three months, oil gushed from that

20101224212722.000|20101224212724.000|TR0|damage will never be known, it is 
20101224212724.000|20101224212726.000|TR0|estimated that more than 205 million 
20101224212726.000|20101224212728.000|TR0|gallons of oil poured into the Gulf.

20101224212754.000|20101224212756.000|TR0|
20101224212756.000|20101224212758.000|TR0|BALDWIN:  And even after the well was 
20101224212758.000|20101224212800.000|TR0|finally capped in mid-July, the 
20101224212800.000|20101224212802.000|TR0|environmental damage still remains unknown.
20101224212802.000|20101224212804.000|TR0|
20101224212804.000|20101224212806.000|TR0|Just a few weeks after the well was 
20101224212806.000|20101224212808.000|TR0|capped, another tragedy, but this one 
20101224212808.000|20101224212810.000|TR0|would come with a happy ending.  You know 
20101224212810.000|20101224212813.000|TR0|the story.  August 5th, 33 Chilean miners 
20101224212813.000|20101224212815.000|TR0|were plunged into dusk and darkness.  A 
20101224212815.000|20101224212817.000|TR0|mine and world (ph) Chile collapsed 
20101224212817.000|20101224212819.000|TR0|trapping the men more than 2,000 feet 
20101224212819.000|20101224212821.000|TR0|below the surface earth.
20101224212821.000|20101224212823.000|TR0|
20101224212823.000|20101224212825.000|TR0|Weeks passed as frantic rescue efforts 
20101224212825.000|20101224212827.000|TR0|were attempted and failed, but on August 
20101224212827.000|20101224212829.000|TR0|22nd, a miracle.  A five and a half inch 
20101224212829.000|20101224212832.000|TR0|borehole reached an emergency shelter room 
20101224212832.000|20101224212834.000|TR0|in the mine.  And when the drill bit 
20101224212834.000|20101224212836.000|TR0|returned to the surface there was a note 
20101224212836.000|20101224212838.000|TR0|attached, quote, "We are all right in the 
20101224212838.000|20101224212840.000|TR0|shelter, the 33 of us."  The 33 men would 
20101224212840.000|20101224212842.000|TR0|spend a record-breaking 69 days below the 
20101224212842.000|20101224212844.000|TR0|earth before the world would witness their 
20101224212844.000|20101224212846.000|TR0|ascent to freedom.
20101224212846.000|20101224212848.000|TR0|
20101224212848.000|20101224212851.000|TR0|Which brings us to the number one story of 
20101224212851.000|20101224212853.000|TR0|2010, a story that has no happy ending, 
20101224212853.000|20101224212855.000|TR0|but one that shook the world and stirred 
20101224212855.000|20101224212857.000|TR0|an outpouring of grief far beyond the 
20101224212857.000|20101224212859.000|TR0|borders of the tiny island nation of Haiti.
20101224212859.000|20101224212901.000|TR0|
20101224212901.000|20101224212903.000|TR0|The earthquake hit early Tuesday evening, 
20101224212903.000|20101224212905.000|TR0|the 12th of January. Seismologists 
20101224212905.000|20101224212907.000|TR0|measured the quake at a magnitude 7.0.  
20101224212907.000|20101224212910.000|TR0|But it would be far more difficult to wrap 
20101224212910.000|20101224212912.000|TR0|our heads around the magnitude of the 
20101224212912.000|20101224212914.000|TR0|human tragedy - 230,000 dead, more than a 
20101224212914.000|20101224212916.000|TR0|million made homeless overnight. Children 
20101224212916.000|20101224212918.000|TR0|orphaned, families separated and perhaps 
20101224212918.000|20101224212920.000|TR0|hardest to bear, unknown thousands trapped 
20101224212920.000|20101224212922.000|TR0|beneath all the rubble - a humanitarian 
20101224212922.000|20101224212924.000|TR0|crisis that continues to this day.
20101224212924.000|20101224212926.000|TR0|

20101224212945.000|20101224212947.000|TR0|

20101224213949.000|20101224213951.000|TR0|hundred flights were grounded as the U.S. 
20101224213951.000|20101224213953.000|TR0|actually sent some of that glycol over 
20101224213953.000|20101224213955.000|TR0|from the States and others arrived from 
20101224213955.000|20101224213957.000|TR0|Germany.  But you're absolutely right.  
20101224213957.000|20101224213959.000|TR0|That was completely unexpected.
20101224213959.000|20101224214002.000|TR0|
20101224214002.000|20101224214004.000|TR0|Now, we've had two issues that are going 
20101224214004.000|20101224214006.000|TR0|on, which is the freezing temperatures and

20101224214008.000|20101224214010.000|TR0|several days. This is unprecedented for

20101224214959.000|20101224215001.000|TR0|REP. JOHN BOEHNER (R), OHIO:  Look at how 
20101224215001.000|20101224215003.000|TR0|this bill is written.  Can you say it was
